medical_history.chief_complaint: Rectal bleeding, syncope, and pain in the right leg.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began five days prior with diffuse abdominal pain that worsened with movement, accompanied by nausea, anorexia, and malaise. Six hours before admission, he experienced a single episode of gross hematochezia and hematuria, followed by syncope and intensified pain in the right leg.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Chronic diarrhea for 2 years, diverticulosis diagnosed via colonoscopy one year prior. History of hypertension, hyperlipidemia, and gout.
medical_history.family_history: Father died of colon cancer at an advanced age.
medical_history.social_history: Remote history of alcohol abuse but no intake for the past 20 years. 100 pack-year smoking history, recently quit.
